jobs.title: Staff Frontend Software Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Synthflow AI is a no-code platform for deploying voice AI agents that automate phone calls across contact center operations and business process outsourcing (BPO) at scale. We help mid-market and enterprise companies manage routine calls to save teams time and resources.

Our agents have already delivered measurable impact:

  • Over 5 million hours of contact center operations saved

  • 35% more calls answered compared to non-AI operators

  • 45 million calls handled with a 99.9% uptime

Backed by Accel, Atlantic Labs, and Singular and trusted by over 1,000 customers, our growth leads an industry shift toward sophisticated and accessible conversational AI.

About the Role

We’re looking for a Staff or Lead Frontend Engineer to drive our frontend architecture, lead
technical decision-making, and grow the frontend discipline at Synthflow. You’ll be our
strongest IC (80%) while also leading and mentoring the frontend team (20%). This role is
both technical and strategic—you'll directly influence the frontend product and tech roadmap
and ensure tight alignment between design, product, and backend teams.

What You'll Do

  • Lead architecture and development of our frontend platform using React,
    TypeScript, and Tailwind.

  • Own and evolve the frontend technical roadmap—performance, scalability, DX, and
    testing.

  • Collaborate closely with backend and infra teams to ensure smooth end-to-end
    system design.

  • Build polished, performant, and highly interactive features used by thousands of
    businesses.

  • Mentor and support other frontend engineers through code reviews, pairing, and
    design sessions.

  • Help shape cross-functional planning and the broader product roadmap.

  • Maintain high quality and stability through robust testing (Jest, Playwright, etc.).

  • Lead with pragmatism—prioritize shipping fast without compromising long-term
    quality

What You Bring

  • 6+ years of experience building modern web applications, with deep expertise in
    React + TypeScript.

  • Proven track record of leading architecture and driving technical direction.

  • Passion for UI/UX detail, performance, and clean code.

  • Experience mentoring engineers and fostering a culture of engineering excellence.

  • Startup mindset: you move fast, think independently, and own outcomes.

  • Experience with cloud platforms (GCP or AWS) and modern CI/CD workflows.

  • Excellent communication and cross-functional collaboration skills.

Bonus

  • Working knowledge of Python and FastAPI—a big plus for aligning effectively with
    backend teams and bridging full-stack workflows.

What We Offer

  • High-impact role: Influence architecture, roadmap, and team direction.

  • Fast-moving environment: Ship quickly, iterate often.

  • Cutting-edge stack: Build with the latest tools and libraries.

  • Competitive compensation: Strong salary, equity, and benefits.

Ready to shape the future of Voice AI? Apply now and join us on the journey.

Founded in Berlin in 2023 by serial entrepreneurs Albert Astabatsyan, Hakob Astabatsyan, and Sassun Mirzakhan-Saky, Synthflow AI democratizes access to advanced voice AI with a no-code platform that lets enterprises easily create, deploy and scale natural-sounding, cost-effective voice agents tailored to their business needs.

  • Design and architect customized solutions and proof-of-concepts (POCs) that prove the value of our platform.

  • Own the full technical customer lifecycle, from responding to RFPs and RFIs to leading the technical onboarding and implementation of our AI phone agents.

  • Serve as the primary technical contact for new and existing customers, troubleshooting integration-related issues and ensuring successful adoption.

  • You have experience or a deep interest in AI/ML technologies and prompt engineering.

  • You excel in clear, effective communication and can comfortably manage both internal and external stakeholder expectations.

  • You are a builder who thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys wearing multiple hats.

  • Career growth: Scale your impact as the company grows.

jobs.title: Machine Learning / NLP Engineer (Working Student)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Synthflow AI is a no-code platform for deploying voice AI agents that automate phone calls across contact center operations and business process outsourcing (BPO) at scale. We help mid-market and enterprise companies manage routine calls to save teams time and resources.

Our agents have already delivered measurable impact:

  • Over 5 million hours of contact center operations saved

  • 35% more calls answered compared to non-AI operators

  • 45 million calls handled with a 99.9% uptime

Backed by Accel, Atlantic Labs, and Singular and trusted by over 1,000 customers, our growth leads an industry shift toward sophisticated and accessible conversational AI.

About the Role
We’re looking for a talented Machine Learning Engineer / NLP Working student who can bridge research and production. You’ll work on cutting-edge NLP projects involving LLMs, Transformers, and Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), building systems that actually ship to users—not just stay in notebooks.

At Synthflow, we power over one million voice AI calls every day. You’ll help bring AI to life, solving real-world problems at a massive scale. Our team works closely with companies like OpenAI, Google and Mistral. Getting early access to models and shaping their roadmap. You will play a contributing role in this.

Responsibilities

  • Implement, fine-tune, and evaluate models such as BERT, Transformers, and modern LLMs.

  • Build and optimize RAG pipelines for production use cases.

  • Conduct LLM evaluations and benchmarking for accuracy, latency, and robustness.

  • Collaborate with engineers and researchers to integrate ML models into our platform.

Requirements

  • Strong Python skills and experience writing clean, maintainable production code (not only Jupyter notebooks).

  • Hands-on experience with PyTorch or similar frameworks.

  • Solid understanding of Transformers, BERT, LLMs, and deep learning fundamentals.

  • Familiarity with NLP tasks such as text classification, QA, summarization, and semantic search.

  • Interest in applied ML research and the ability to read & implement recent papers.

  • Master’s degree (or currently pursuing a Master’s) in Computer Science or a closely related field; ideally with excellent academic performance.

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience with audio/acoustic ML: ASR (automatic speech recognition) and TTS (text-to-speech).

  • Experience with vector databases (e.g., Qdrant, Pinecone, Weaviate).

  • Exposure to LangChain, LlamaIndex, or other LLM orchestration tools.

  • Understanding of LLM evaluation techniques and metrics.

What We Offer

  • Opportunity to work with cutting-edge LLM, NLP, and speech AI technology.

  • Hands-on mentorship and the ability to ship real products that solve customer needs.

  • Flexible work environment and growth opportunities.

  • The ability to publish your work in blog posts or academic journals.

We’re hiring an Applied LLM Engineer who lives and breathes prompt engineering and writes excellent production-grade Python. You’ll run a tight feedback loop with customers, turn real conversations into better prompts and eval datasets, and ship changes that measurably improve agent outcomes. This is a highly applied role working directly with customer feedback.

What You’ll Do

  • Design & iterate prompts (system, tool/function-calling, task prompts) to boost voice AI agent success, reliability, and tone.

  • Build co-pilots for customers to author their own prompts: meta-prompted assistants that suggest structures, lint for risks, autocomplete tool schemas, critique drafts, and generate eval cases.

  • Work directly with customer feedback and conversation logs to identify failure modes; translate them into prompt changes, guardrails, and data improvements.

  • Build eval datasets (success labels, rubrics, edge cases, regressions) and run offline/online evaluations (A/B tests, canaries) to quantify impact.

  • Create Python utilities/services for prompt versioning, config-as-code, rollout/rollback, and guardrails (policies, refusals, redaction).

  • Partner with PM/Success to define success metrics (task completion, first-pass accuracy, cost, latency) and instrument dashboards/alerts.

  • Own LLM integration details: function/tool schemas, output parsing/validation (pydantic), retrieval-aware prompting, and fallback strategies.

  • Ensure privacy & compliance (PII handling, anonymization, regional data boundaries) in datasets and logs.

  • Share learnings via concise docs, playbooks, and internal demos.

Must-Have Skills

  • Python: 3+ years writing clean, tested, production code (typing, pytest, profiling); experience building small services/APIs (FastAPI preferred).

  • Prompt Engineering: Hands-on experience designing system/tool prompts, meta-prompting, rubric graders, and iterative prompt tuning based on real user data.

  • LLM Integration: Comfortable with major APIs (OpenAI/Anthropic/Google/Mistral), function/tool calling, streaming, and robust output handling.

  • Evaluation Mindset: Ability to define measurable success, create labeled datasets, and run methodical experiments/A/B tests.

  • Product Sense: Comfortable talking with customers, turning qualitative feedback into shipped improvements.

  • Data Hygiene: Practical experience cleaning, labeling, and balancing datasets; awareness of privacy/PII constraints.

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience building prompt-authoring UIs/SDKs or internal tooling for prompt versioning and governance.

  • Agentic frameworks & tooling: DSpy, MCP, LangGraph, LlamaIndex, Rasa; experience with agent/tool schemas and orchestration.

  • Observability & eval tooling: Langfuse, LangSmith, Braintrust; building eval harnesses and experiment dashboards.

  • RAG & vector stores: Qdrant/Weaviate/Pinecone and retrieval-aware prompting.

  • Experimentation workflows: A/B testing, prompt diffing/versioning.

  • Infra & analytics: light SQL/log analysis, metrics & tracing, simple Grafana/OTel dashboards.

  • Writing public blog posts or talks about applied LLM techniques.

  1. 30-min intro screen – background, role fit, questions both ways.

  2. Practical exercise (Prompt + Python) – design a prompt strategy, a customer-facing co-pilot flow, and a small eval harness.

  3. Team interviews – deep dive on product mindset, experimentation rigor, and collaboration.

  4. Founder/Leadership chat – scope, impact, and ways of working.

Why Join

About the Role

As a Project Manager on the Professional Services team at Synthflow AI, you’ll lead the planning, coordination, and delivery of enterprise AI implementations for some of the world’s most innovative companies. You’ll serve as the central point of alignment between our customers and internal teams, ensuring projects are executed on time, within scope, and with exceptional quality.

You’ll work cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, and Customer Success to translate business goals into structured project plans — driving accountability, managing dependencies, and maintaining clear communication at every stage. This is a high-impact, customer-facing role where precision, collaboration, and execution excellence define success.

Your Responsibilities

  • Lead the end-to-end delivery of enterprise AI implementation projects from kickoff through post-launch.

  • Partner with internal teams (Product, Engineering, Solutions, Customer Success) to align on requirements, milestones, and deliverables.

  • Serve as the primary point of contact for customers, managing timelines, communications, and expectations.

  • Proactively identify and mitigate risks, resolve blockers, and ensure on-time delivery.

  • Provide transparent reporting and regular status updates to stakeholders.

  • Contribute to the continuous improvement of Synthflow’s implementation frameworks and playbooks to enable scalable, high-quality delivery.

  • 5+ years of experience in Project or Program Management, ideally within enterprise SaaS, AI, or professional services environments.

  • Highly organized and detail-oriented, able to manage multiple complex projects simultaneously.

  • Strong communicator who builds trust across both technical and business audiences.

  • Analytical and proactive, with the ability to anticipate risks and make data-informed decisions.

  • Thrive in a high-growth, fast-paced environment where collaboration and adaptability are key.

  • Experience with CCaaS (Contact Center as a Service) or Customer Experience platforms recognized in the Gartner Magic Quadrant (e.g., Talkdesk, Five9, NICE, Genesys, or similar).

  • Background in Professional Services, Customer Implementations, or Solutions Delivery.
